Field Detail

TAGS_COVARIANCE_TYPE

public static final Tag[] TAGS_COVARIANCE_TYPE
the type of covariance matrices for gaussian HMMs. A FULL matrix allows arbitrary dependencies between variables, a DIAGONAL matrix assumes that all variables are independent. SPHERICAL models assume that variables are independent and all have the same variance. SPHERICAL covariances imply a more restricted set of models than DIAGONAL covariances which are more restricted than FULL matrices. Restricted models require less data to learn but may not be able to model all features of the data.

Constructor Detail

HMM

public HMM()
Method Detail

getSequenceAttribute

public int getSequenceAttribute()

isRandomStateInitializers

public boolean isRandomStateInitializers()
gets whether the HMM state probabilities are randomly initialized. If this is false (default) the states are set using clustering on the dataset.

setRandomStateInitializers

public void setRandomStateInitializers(boolean randomStateInitializers)
sets whether the HMM state probabilities are randomly initialized. If this is false (default) the states are set using clustering on the dataset.

Parameters:
randomStateInitializers - if true the HMM state probabilities will be initialized randomly, if false they will be initialized using clustering

isTied

public boolean isTied()
gets whether the covariance matrices of guassian HMMs are tied. Tied covariances are the same for all states of the HMM. Using tied covariances makes it possible to learn models from less data but restricts the class of models that can be learned.

setTied

public void setTied(boolean tied)
sets whether the covariance matrices of guassian HMMs are tied. Tied covariances are the same for all states of the HMM. Using tied covariances makes it possible to learn models from less data but restricts the class of models that can be learned.

Parameters:
tied - if true the covariances will be tied

getCovarianceType

public SelectedTag getCovarianceType()
get the type of covariance matrices for gaussian HMMs. A FULL matrix allows arbitrary dependencies between variables, a DIAGONAL matrix assumes that all variables are independent. SPHERICAL models assume that variables are independent and all have the same variance. SPHERICAL covariances imply a more restricted set of models than DIAGONAL covariances which are more restricted than FULL matrices. Restricted models require less data to learn but may not be able to model all features of the data.

setCovarianceType

public void setCovarianceType(SelectedTag covarianceType)
set the type of covariance matrices for gaussian HMMs. A FULL matrix allows arbitrary dependencies between variables, a DIAGONAL matrix assumes that all variables are independent. SPHERICAL models assume that variables are independent and all have the same variance. SPHERICAL covariances imply a more restricted set of models than DIAGONAL covariances which are more restricted than FULL matrices. Restricted models require less data to learn but may not be able to model all features of the data.

Parameters:
covarianceType - the covariance type (possibilities are COVARIANCE_FULL, COVARIANCE_DIAGONAL, COVARIANCE_SPHERICAL)

isLeftRight

public boolean isLeftRight()
gets whether the HMM has a Left-Right state structure In a left-right HMM the sequences of states are always passed through in a fixed order (possibly missing some states). The alternative is an ergodic model (default) in which arbitrary transitions can be made.

setLeftRight

public void setLeftRight(boolean leftRight)
sets whether the HMM has a Left-Right state structure In a left-right HMM the sequences of states are always passed through in a fixed order (possibly missing some states). The alternative is an ergodic model (default) in which arbitrary transitions can be made.

Parameters:
leftRight - if true the HMM will be left-right, if false it will be ergodic

getNumClasses

public int getNumClasses()
gets the number of classes for the HMM classifier. The value is set automatically from the data

getNumStates

public int getNumStates()
gets the number of hidden states in the HMM

setNumStates

public void setNumStates(int numStates)
sets the number of hidden states in the HMM. The number of states is the major parameter of an HMM and must be set (it is not learnt from the data).

Parameters:
numStates - the number of states to be used

getNumOutputs

gets the number distinct output (observation) values for nominal data This is set automatically from data.

Parameters:

probabilitiesForInstance

public double[][] probabilitiesForInstance(int classId,
                                           Instance instance)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
evaluate the state occupancy probabilities for a particular sequence

Parameters:
classId - the class for which to do the evaluation
instance - the data instance (sequence) to evaluate
Returns:
a two dimensional array of probabilities (doubles). Item [i][j] gives the probability of being in state j for the ith item in the sequence.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
